document.masterDocTitle: Genus Stathmopoda Herrich-Schäffer, 1853 (Lepidoptera: Stathmopodidae) from China (III): Descriptions of fourteen new species

Diagnosis. This species is characterized by the forewing with a sub-trapezoidal and a sub-rhombic brown patches; in the female genitalia by the signum with length as wide as the corpus bursae and the transition of corpus bursae and the appendix bursae with a few of scattered spicules. This species is similar to
S. flavescens Kuznetzov, 1984
and
S. callicarpicola Terada, 2012
, and the differences between them are stated in the diagnosis of the latter two species.

Description. Adult ( Fig. 26 ). Wingspan 8.5‒13.0 mm. Head with frons silvery white; vertex silvery white to yellow; occiput brown, yellow laterally. Labial palpus silvery white on inner surface, pale yellow on outer surface. Antenna ochreous yellow, silvery white on anterior margin of scape. Collar ochreous yellow; thorax ochreous yellow, with brown spot posterolaterally, with a brown spot on posterior margin; tegula yellow. Forewing yellow; costal margin brown, paler toward apex, with a small yellow spot at base; basal fascia brown; dorsal margin with two brown patches: first patch at basal 1/3, sub-trapezoidal, slightly crossing anterior margin of cell, second patch at basal 2/3, sub-rhombic, extending obliquely outward and crossing anterior angle of cell, with a slender brown streak from its outer side extending straightly to apex, two patches linked by a brown streak on dorsal margin; fringe greyish brown. Hindwing and fringe grey. Legs ochreous yellow on dorsal surface, yellowish white on ventral surface; foreleg with tibia blackish brown on outer surface, tarsus blackish brown at apex; midleg with tibia blackish brown at base on dorsal surface, with ochreous yellow bristles at middle and apex; hindleg with tibia with a blackish brown line on inner surface, bearing long ochreous brown bristles at basal 1/3, 2/3 and apex on dorsal surface, tarsus blackish brown at apices of basal three tarsomeres, with ochreous brown bristles at apices of basal two tarsomeres. Abdomen with anterior half of each segment pale brown and posterior half pale yellow on dorsal surface, yellowish white on ventral surface.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Host plant.
Callicarpa japanica Thunb.
( Lamiaceae ) ( Terada 2012 ).
Distribution. China ( Guangxi , Guizhou , Hainan , Hubei , Taiwan , Tianjin , Zhejiang ); Japan .
Notes. This species is newly recorded for China .
